active_learning.discussion_prompt: How would you apply this concept in your work environment?
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student teaches the other about structured (e.g., relational database), semi-structured (e.g., JSON logs), and unstructured data (e.g., marketing video), providing 2 examples and 2 non-examples per type. Switch roles and quiz each other on classification implications for protection.
active_learning.problem_solving: Individually or in teams, classify 10 sample data assets (e.g., customer PII database, public website content, employee HR files, R&D prototypes, marketing emails, log files, financial reports, vendor contracts, social media posts, backup tapes) using a NIST-inspired scheme. Justify protection levels (e.g., encryption for Confidential) and link to CIS Control 3 requirements.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in CIS Critical Security Controls v8.1. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards on 'Data Classification Schemes' (Topic Hierarchy: Level 1 Cybersecurity → Level 2 Security And Risk Management → Level 3 Security Control Frameworks → Level 4 CIS Critical Security Controls v8.1 → Level 5 Basic CIS Controls (Controls 1-6) → Level 6 Data Classification Schemes). Base content on this research summary: [Insert full research context here, including completed NIST (4 levels: Public/Internal/Confidential/Restricted), CIS v8.1 Control 3 (classify data for protection), data types (structured/semi/unstructured), lifecycle, governance]. Integrate voter priorities: completeness (NIST/CIS details), pedagogy (Bloom's progression), active learning, 4-layer scaffolding, concept map, CIS links (esp. Controls 1 & 3), prior knowledge (Control 1 prerequisite). Learning Objectives: [paste array above]. Active Learning: [paste activities]. Scaffolding: [paste layers]. Output exactly 50 flashcards as JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'back': '...', 'type': 'mcq|definition|cloze|application', 'bloom_level': 'remember|etc.', 'related_scaffolding_layer': '1-4', 'related_objective': '1-6', 'explanation': '...'}]. Distribute: 20% remember/understand (Layer 1), 30% apply (Layer 2-3), 30% analyze (Layer 3), 20% evaluate/create (Layer 4). 40% MCQ (with distractors per protocol), 30% definition/cloze, 30% scenario/application. Ensure variety, no repetition, alignment to CIS v8.1 Control 3 & basics 1-6. Make engaging/educational.
